00020 #include <stddef.h>

00033 struct ccn_sigc {
00034     EVP_MD_CTX context;
00035     HMAC_CTX hmac_context;
00036     void *ctx_to_use;
00037     int key_len;
00038     const EVP_MD *md;
00039     int (*init_func)(void *ctx, const void *key, int len, const EVP_MD *md);
00040     int (*update_func)(void *ctx, const void *data, size_t count);
00041     int (*final_func)(void *ctx, unsigned char *sigret, unsigned int *siglen, EVP_PKEY *pkey);
00042     int (*verify_init_func)(void *ctx, const void *key, int len, const EVP_MD *md);
00043     int (*verify_final_func)(void *ctx, const unsigned char *sigbuf, unsigned int siglen, EVP_PKEY *pkey);
00044     void (*cleanup_func)(struct ccn_sigc *ctx);
00045 };
00046 
00047 #if !defined(OPENSSL_NO_EC) && !defined(OPENSSL_NO_ECDSA) && defined(NID_ecdsa_with_SHA256)
00048 static int init256(EVP_MD_CTX *ctx)
00049 { return SHA256_Init(ctx->md_data); }
00050 static int update256(EVP_MD_CTX *ctx,const void *data,size_t count)
00051 { return SHA256_Update(ctx->md_data,data,count); }
00052 static int final256(EVP_MD_CTX *ctx,unsigned char *md)
00053 { return SHA256_Final(md,ctx->md_data); }
00054 
00055 static const EVP_MD sha256ec_md=
00056 {
00057     NID_sha256,
00058     NID_ecdsa_with_SHA256,
00059     SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH,
00060     0,
00061     init256,
00062     update256,
00063     final256,
00064     NULL,
00065     NULL,
00066     EVP_PKEY_ECDSA_method,
00067     SHA256_CBLOCK,
00068     sizeof(EVP_MD *)+sizeof(SHA256_CTX),
00069 };
00070 #endif

00072 #if defined(NEED_OPENSSL_1_0_COMPAT)
00073 /*
00074  * In theory this should allow us to "seamlessly integrate" with OpenSSL 1.0.X (and eventually remove this) 
00075  */
00076 void *EVP_PKEY_get0(EVP_PKEY *pkey)
00077 {
00078     return pkey->pkey.ptr;
00079 }

00081 int ccn_PKEY_assign(EVP_PKEY *pkey, int type, char *key) {
00082     if (EVP_PKEY_assign(pkey, type, key) == 0)
00083         return (0);
00084     pkey->type = type; // Override type checking
00085     return (key != NULL);
00086 }

00090 int ccn_hmac_init(void *ctx, const void *key, int len, const EVP_MD *md) 
00091 { 
00092     HMAC_Init((HMAC_CTX *)ctx, ASN1_STRING_data((ASN1_STRING *)key), len, md);
00093     return (1);
00094 }
00095 
00096 int ccn_evp_sign_init(void *ctx, const void *key, int len, const EVP_MD *md)
00097 {
00098     return EVP_SignInit_ex((EVP_MD_CTX *)ctx, md, NULL);
00099 }
00100 
00101 int ccn_evp_verify_init(void *ctx, const void *key, int len, const EVP_MD *md)
00102 {
00103     return EVP_VerifyInit((EVP_MD_CTX *)ctx, md);
00104 }
00105 
00106 int ccn_hmac_final(void *ctx, unsigned char *sigret, unsigned int *siglen, EVP_PKEY *pkey) 
00107 {
00108     HMAC_Final((HMAC_CTX *)ctx, sigret, siglen);
00109     return (1);
00110 }
00111 
00112 int ccn_hmac_verify_final(void *ctx, const unsigned char *sigret, unsigned int siglen, 
00113                         EVP_PKEY *pkey) 
00114 {
00115     unsigned char buf[EVP_MAX_MD_SIZE];
00116     unsigned int len = siglen;
00117 
00118     HMAC_Final((HMAC_CTX *)ctx, (unsigned char *)buf, &siglen);
00119     if (memcmp(buf, sigret, len))
00120         return (0);
00121     return (1);
00122 }
00123 
00124 static void cleanup_evp_ctx(struct ccn_sigc *sigc) {
00125     EVP_MD_CTX_cleanup(&(sigc->context));
00126 }
00127 
00128 static void cleanup_hmac_ctx(struct ccn_sigc *sigc) {
00129     HMAC_CTX_cleanup(&(sigc->hmac_context));
00130 }
00131 
00132 static int
00133 sigc_from_digest_and_pkey(struct ccn_sigc *sigc, const char *digest, const struct ccn_pkey *pkey)
00134 {
00135     int md_nid;
00136     int pkey_type;
00137 
00138     /* This encapsulates knowledge that the default digest algorithm for
00139      * signing is SHA256.  See also CCN_SIGNING_DEFAULT_DIGEST_ALGORITHM
00140      * in ccn/ccn.h.  We could call OBJ_txt2nid(), but this would be rather
00141      * inefficient.  If there were a place to stand for overall signing
00142      * initialization then that would be an appropriate place to do so.
00143      */
00144     if (digest == NULL) {
00145         md_nid = NID_sha256;
00146     }
00147     else {
00148         /* figure out what algorithm the OID represents */
00149         md_nid = OBJ_txt2nid(digest);
00150         if (md_nid == NID_undef) {
00151             fprintf(stderr, "not a DigestAlgorithm I understand right now: %s\n", digest);
00152             return (0);
00153         }
00154     }
00155 
00156 #if defined(NEED_OPENSSL_1_0_COMPAT)
00157     pkey_type = ((EVP_PKEY *)pkey)->type;
00158 #else
00159     pkey_type = EVP_PKEY_type(((EVP_PKEY *)pkey)->type);
00160 #endif
00161     if (md_nid == NID_hmac || pkey_type == NID_hmac) {
00162         sigc->init_func = (int (*)(void *ctx, const void *, int, const EVP_MD *))ccn_hmac_init;
00163         sigc->verify_init_func = (int (*)(void *ctx, const void *, int, const EVP_MD *))ccn_hmac_init;
00164         sigc->update_func = (int (*)(void *, const void *, size_t))HMAC_Update;
00165         sigc->final_func = ccn_hmac_final;
00166         sigc->verify_final_func = ccn_hmac_verify_final;
00167         sigc->md = EVP_sha256();
00168         sigc->key_len = 32;
00169         sigc->cleanup_func = cleanup_hmac_ctx;
00170         sigc->ctx_to_use = &sigc->hmac_context;
00171         HMAC_CTX_init(&sigc->hmac_context);
00172         return (1);
00173     }
00174 
00175     sigc->init_func = ccn_evp_sign_init;
00176     sigc->verify_init_func = ccn_evp_verify_init;
00177     sigc->update_func = (int (*)(void *, const void *, size_t))EVP_DigestUpdate;
00178     sigc->final_func = (int (*)(void *, unsigned char *, unsigned int *, EVP_PKEY *))EVP_SignFinal;
00179     sigc->verify_final_func = (int (*)(void *, const unsigned char *, unsigned int, EVP_PKEY *))EVP_VerifyFinal;
00180     sigc->cleanup_func = cleanup_evp_ctx;
00181     EVP_MD_CTX_init(&sigc->context);
00182     sigc->ctx_to_use = &sigc->context;
00183     switch (pkey_type) {
00184         case EVP_PKEY_RSA:
00185         case EVP_PKEY_DSA:
00186 #if !defined(OPENSSL_NO_EC)
00187         case EVP_PKEY_EC:
00188 #endif
00189             break;
00190         default:
00191             fprintf(stderr, "not a Key type I understand right now: NID %d\n", pkey_type);
00192             return(0);
00193     }
00194     /*
00195      * In OpenSSL 0.9.8 the digest algorithm and key type determine the
00196      * digest and signature methods that are in the staticly defined
00197      * EVP_MD structures, so we need to get the correct predefined one, or
00198      * create our own.
00199      * In OpenSSL 1.0.0 the EVP_MD structure allows for the key that is passed
00200      * in the signature finalization step to determine the signature algorithm
00201      * applied to the digest, so we would be able to use a single SHA256 context
00202      * independent of the key type (assuming size compatability).
00203      * At the point that 1.0.0 or later is the default provider we could simplify
00204      * this code.   The Java code (OIDLookup.java) uses a much more elaborate
00205      * set of hash maps to perform a similar function.
00206      */
00207     switch (md_nid) {
00208 #ifndef OPENSSL_NO_SHA
00209         case NID_sha1:      // supported for RSA/DSA/EC key types
00210             switch (pkey_type) {
00211                 case EVP_PKEY_RSA:
00212                     sigc->md = EVP_sha1();
00213                     return(1);
00214                 case EVP_PKEY_DSA:
00215                     sigc->md = EVP_dss1();
00216                     return(1);
00217 #if !defined(OPENSSL_NO_EC) && !defined(OPENSSL_NO_ECDSA)
00218                 case EVP_PKEY_EC:
00219                     sigc->md = EVP_ecdsa();
00220                     return (1);
00221 #endif
00222             }
00223             break;
00224 #endif
00225         case NID_sha256:    // supported for RSA/EC key types
00226             if (pkey_type == EVP_PKEY_RSA) {
00227                 sigc->md = EVP_sha256();
00228                 return(1);
00229             }
00230 #if !defined(OPENSSL_NO_EC) && !defined(OPENSSL_NO_ECDSA) && defined(NID_ecdsa_with_SHA256)
00231             else if (pkey_type == EVP_PKEY_EC) {
00232                 sigc->md = &sha256ec_md;
00233                 return(1);
00234             } /* our own md */
00235 #endif
00236             break;
00237         case NID_sha512:     // supported for RSA
00238             if (pkey_type == EVP_PKEY_RSA)
00239                 sigc->md = EVP_sha512();
00240                 return(1);
00241         default:
00242             break;
00243     }
00244     fprintf(stderr, "not a Digest+Signature algorithm I understand right now: %s with NID %d\n",
00245             digest, pkey_type);
00246     return (0);
00247 }

00249 struct ccn_sigc *
00250 ccn_sigc_create(void)
00251 {
00252     return (calloc(1, sizeof(struct ccn_sigc)));
00253 }
00254 
00255 void
00256 ccn_sigc_destroy(struct ccn_sigc **ctx)
00257 {
00258     if (*ctx) {
00259         // XXX - is it OK to call cleanup unconditionally?
00260         (*(*ctx)->cleanup_func)((*ctx));
00261         free(*ctx);
00262         *ctx = NULL;
00263     }
00264 }
00265 
00266 int
00267 ccn_sigc_init(struct ccn_sigc *ctx, const char *digest, const struct ccn_pkey *key)
00268 {
00269     if (!sigc_from_digest_and_pkey(ctx, digest, key))
00270         return (-1);
00271     if (0 == (*ctx->init_func)(ctx->ctx_to_use, EVP_PKEY_get0((EVP_PKEY *)key), ctx->key_len, 
00272                         ctx->md))
00273         return (-1);
00274     return (0);
00275 }
00276 
00277 int
00278 ccn_sigc_update(struct ccn_sigc *ctx, const void *data, size_t size)
00279 {
00280     if (0 == (*ctx->update_func)(ctx->ctx_to_use, (unsigned char *)data, size))
00281         return (-1);
00282     return (0);
00283 }
00284 
00285 int
00286 ccn_sigc_final(struct ccn_sigc *ctx, struct ccn_signature *signature, size_t *size, const struct ccn_pkey *priv_key)
00287 {
00288     unsigned int sig_size;
00289 
00290     if (0 == (*ctx->final_func)(ctx->ctx_to_use, (unsigned char *)signature, &sig_size, (EVP_PKEY *)priv_key))
00291         return (-1);
00292     *size = sig_size;
00293     return (0);
00294 }
00295 
00296 size_t
00297 ccn_sigc_signature_max_size(struct ccn_sigc *ctx, const struct ccn_pkey *key)
00298 {
00299 #if defined(NEED_OPENSSL_1_0_COMPAT)
00300     if (((EVP_PKEY *)key)->type == EVP_PKEY_HMAC)
00301         return EVP_MAX_MD_SIZE;
00302 #endif
00303     return (EVP_PKEY_size((EVP_PKEY *)key));
00304 }
00305 
00306 #define is_left(x) (0 == (x & 1))
00307 #define node_lr(x) (x & 1)
00308 #define sibling_of(x) (x ^ 1)
00309 #define parent_of(x) (x >> 1)
00310 
00311 int ccn_merkle_root_hash(const unsigned char *msg, size_t size,
00312                          const struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *co,
00313                          const EVP_MD *digest_type,
00314                          MP_info *merkle_path_info,
00315                          unsigned char *result, int result_size)
00316 {
00317     int node = ASN1_INTEGER_get(merkle_path_info->node);
00318     EVP_MD_CTX digest_context;
00319     EVP_MD_CTX *digest_contextp = &digest_context;
00320     size_t data_size;
00321     unsigned char *input_hash[2] = {NULL, NULL};
00322     //int hash_count = sk_ASN1_OCTET_STRING_num(merkle_path_info->hashes);
00323     int hash_index = sk_ASN1_OCTET_STRING_num(merkle_path_info->hashes) - 1;
00324     //ASN1_OCTET_STRING *sibling_hash;
00325     int res;
00326     
00327     if (result_size != EVP_MD_size(digest_type))
00328         return -1;
00329 
00330     /*
00331      * This is the calculation for the node we're starting from
00332      *
00333      * The digest type for the leaf node we'll take from the MHT OID
00334      * We can assume that, since we're using the same digest function, the
00335      * result size will always be the same.
00336      */
00337 
00338     EVP_MD_CTX_init(digest_contextp);
00339     EVP_DigestInit_ex(digest_contextp, digest_type, NULL);
00340     data_size = co->offset[CCN_PCO_E_Content] - co->offset[CCN_PCO_B_Name];
00341     res = EVP_DigestUpdate(digest_contextp, msg + co->offset[CCN_PCO_B_Name], data_size);
00342     res &= EVP_DigestFinal_ex(digest_contextp, result, NULL);
00343     EVP_MD_CTX_cleanup(digest_contextp);
00344     if (res != 1)
00345         return(-1);
00346     /* input_hash[0, 1] = address of hash for (left,right) node of parent
00347      */
00348     while (node != 1) {
00349         input_hash[node & 1] = result;
00350         input_hash[(node & 1) ^ 1] = sk_ASN1_OCTET_STRING_value(merkle_path_info->hashes, hash_index)->data;
00351         if (sk_ASN1_OCTET_STRING_value(merkle_path_info->hashes, hash_index)->length != result_size)
00352             return (-1);
00353         hash_index -= 1;
00354 #ifdef DEBUG
00355         fprintf(stderr, "node[%d].lefthash = ", parent_of(node));
00356         for (int x = 0; x < result_size; x++) {
00357             fprintf(stderr, "%02x", input_hash[0][x]);
00358         }
00359         fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00360    
00361         fprintf(stderr, "node[%d].righthash = ", parent_of(node));
00362         for (int x = 0; x < result_size; x++) {
00363             fprintf(stderr, "%02x", input_hash[1][x]);
00364         }
00365         fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00366 #endif
00367         EVP_MD_CTX_init(digest_contextp);
00368         res = EVP_DigestInit_ex(digest_contextp, digest_type, NULL);
00369         res &= EVP_DigestUpdate(digest_contextp, input_hash[0], result_size);
00370         res &= EVP_DigestUpdate(digest_contextp, input_hash[1], result_size);
00371         res &= EVP_DigestFinal_ex(digest_contextp, result, NULL);
00372         EVP_MD_CTX_cleanup(digest_contextp);
00373         if (res != 1)
00374             return(-1);
00375         node = parent_of(node);
00376    
00377 #ifdef DEBUG
00378         fprintf(stderr, "yielding node[%d] hash = ", node);
00379         for (int x = 0; x < result_size; x++) {
00380             fprintf(stderr, "%02x", result[x]);
00381         }
00382         fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00383 #endif
00384     }
00385     return (0);
00386 }
00387 
00388 int ccn_verify_signature(const unsigned char *msg,
00389                      size_t size,
00390                      const struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *co,
00391                      const struct ccn_pkey *verification_key)
00392 {
00393     X509_SIG *digest_info = NULL;
00394     const unsigned char *dd = NULL;
00395     MP_info *merkle_path_info = NULL;
00396     unsigned char *root_hash = NULL;
00397     size_t root_hash_size;
00398 
00399     int res;
00400 
00401     const EVP_MD *merkle_path_digest = NULL;
00402     
00403     const unsigned char *signature_bits = NULL;
00404     size_t signature_bits_size = 0;
00405     const unsigned char *witness = NULL;
00406     size_t witness_size = 0;
00407     const unsigned char *digest_algorithm = NULL;
00408     size_t digest_algorithm_size;
00409     struct ccn_sigc *sigc;
00410     
00411     EVP_PKEY *pkey = (EVP_PKEY *)verification_key;
00412 
00413     res = ccn_ref_tagged_BLOB(CCN_DTAG_SignatureBits, msg,
00414                               co->offset[CCN_PCO_B_SignatureBits],
00415                               co->offset[CCN_PCO_E_SignatureBits],
00416                               &signature_bits,
00417                               &signature_bits_size);
00418     if (res < 0)
00419         return (-1);
00420 
00421     if (co->offset[CCN_PCO_B_DigestAlgorithm] == co->offset[CCN_PCO_E_DigestAlgorithm]) {
00422         digest_algorithm = (const unsigned char *)CCN_SIGNING_DEFAULT_DIGEST_ALGORITHM;
00423     }
00424     else {
00425         /* figure out what algorithm the OID represents */
00426         res = ccn_ref_tagged_string(CCN_DTAG_DigestAlgorithm, msg,
00427                                   co->offset[CCN_PCO_B_DigestAlgorithm],
00428                                   co->offset[CCN_PCO_E_DigestAlgorithm],
00429                                   &digest_algorithm,
00430                                   &digest_algorithm_size);
00431         if (res < 0)
00432             return (-1);
00433         /* NOTE: since the element closer is a 0, and the element is well formed,
00434          * the string will be null terminated 
00435          */
00436     }
00437     sigc = ccn_sigc_create();
00438     if (!sigc_from_digest_and_pkey(sigc, (const char *)digest_algorithm, verification_key)) {
00439         res = -1;
00440         goto Bail;
00441     }
00442     res = (*sigc->init_func)(sigc->ctx_to_use, EVP_PKEY_get0((EVP_PKEY *)verification_key), 
00443                         sigc->key_len, sigc->md);
00444     if (!res) {
00445         res = -1;
00446         goto Bail;
00447     }
00448     if (co->offset[CCN_PCO_B_Witness] != co->offset[CCN_PCO_E_Witness]) {
00449         /* The witness is a DigestInfo, where the octet-string therein encapsulates
00450          * a sequence of [integer (origin 1 node#), sequence of [octet-string]]
00451          * where the inner octet-string is the concatenated hashes on the merkle-path
00452          */
00453         res = ccn_ref_tagged_BLOB(CCN_DTAG_Witness, msg,
00454                                   co->offset[CCN_PCO_B_Witness],
00455                                   co->offset[CCN_PCO_E_Witness],
00456                                   &witness,
00457                                   &witness_size);
00458         if (res < 0) {
00459             res = -1;
00460             goto Bail;
00461         }
00462 
00463         digest_info = d2i_X509_SIG(NULL, &witness, witness_size);
00464         /* digest_info->algor->algorithm->{length, data}
00465          * digest_info->digest->{length, type, data}
00466          */
00467         /* ...2.2 is an MHT w/ SHA256 */
00468         ASN1_OBJECT *merkle_hash_tree_oid = OBJ_txt2obj("1.2.840.113550.11.1.2.2", 1);
00469         if (0 != OBJ_cmp(digest_info->algor->algorithm, merkle_hash_tree_oid)) {
00470             fprintf(stderr, "A witness is present without an MHT OID!\n");
00471             ASN1_OBJECT_free(merkle_hash_tree_oid);
00472             res = -1;
00473             goto Bail;
00474         }
00475         /* we're doing an MHT */
00476         ASN1_OBJECT_free(merkle_hash_tree_oid);
00477         merkle_path_digest = EVP_sha256();
00478         /* DER-encoded in the digest_info's digest ASN.1 octet string is the Merkle path info */
00479         dd = digest_info->digest->data;
00480         merkle_path_info = d2i_MP_info(NULL, &dd, digest_info->digest->length);
00481         X509_SIG_free(digest_info);
00482 #ifdef DEBUG
00483         int x,h;
00484         int node = ASN1_INTEGER_get(merkle_path_info->node);
00485         int hash_count = sk_ASN1_OCTET_STRING_num(merkle_path_info->hashes);
00486         ASN1_OCTET_STRING *hash;
00487         fprintf(stderr, "A witness is present with an MHT OID\n");
00488         fprintf(stderr, "This is node %d, with %d hashes\n", node, hash_count);
00489         for (h = 0; h < hash_count; h++) {
00490             hash = sk_ASN1_OCTET_STRING_value(merkle_path_info->hashes, h);
00491             fprintf(stderr, "     hashes[%d] len = %d data = ", h, hash->length);
00492             for (x = 0; x < hash->length; x++) {
00493                 fprintf(stderr, "%02x", hash->data[x]);
00494             }
00495             fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00496         }
00497 #endif
00498         /* In the MHT signature case, we signed/verify the root hash */
00499         root_hash_size = EVP_MD_size(merkle_path_digest);
00500         root_hash = calloc(1, root_hash_size);
00501         res = ccn_merkle_root_hash(msg, size, co, merkle_path_digest, merkle_path_info, root_hash, root_hash_size);
00502         MP_info_free(merkle_path_info);
00503         if (res < 0) {
00504             free(root_hash);
00505             res = -1;
00506             goto Bail;
00507         }
00508         res = (*sigc->update_func)(sigc->ctx_to_use, root_hash, root_hash_size);
00509         free(root_hash);
00510         if (res == 0) {
00511             res = -1;
00512             goto Bail;
00513         }
00514         res = (*sigc->verify_final_func)(sigc->ctx_to_use, signature_bits, signature_bits_size, pkey);
00515     } else {
00516         /*
00517          * In the simple signature case, we signed/verify from the name through
00518          * the end of the content.
00519          */
00520         size_t signed_size = co->offset[CCN_PCO_E_Content] - co->offset[CCN_PCO_B_Name];
00521         res = (*sigc->update_func)(sigc->ctx_to_use, msg + co->offset[CCN_PCO_B_Name], signed_size);
00522         if (res == 0) {
00523             res = -1;
00524             goto Bail;
00525         }
00526         res = (*sigc->verify_final_func)(sigc->ctx_to_use, signature_bits, signature_bits_size, pkey);
00527     }
00528 Bail:
00529     ccn_sigc_destroy(&sigc);
00530     return (res);
00531 }
00532 
00533 struct ccn_pkey *
00534 ccn_d2i_pubkey(const unsigned char *p, size_t size)
00535 {
00536     const unsigned char *q = p;
00537     EVP_PKEY *ans;
00538     ans = d2i_PUBKEY(NULL, &q, size);
00539     return ((struct ccn_pkey *)ans);
00540 }
00541 
00542 void
00543 ccn_pubkey_free(struct ccn_pkey *i_pubkey)
00544 {
00545     EVP_PKEY *pkey = (EVP_PKEY *)i_pubkey;
00546     EVP_PKEY_free(pkey);
00547 }
00548 
00549 size_t
00550 ccn_pubkey_size(const struct ccn_pkey *i_pubkey)
00551 {
00552     size_t ans;
00553     EVP_PKEY *pkey = (EVP_PKEY *)i_pubkey;
00554     ans = EVP_PKEY_size(pkey);
00555     return (ans);
00556 }
00557 
00558 int
00559 ccn_append_pubkey_blob(struct ccn_charbuf *c, const struct ccn_pkey *i_pubkey)
00560 {
00561     int res;
00562     size_t bytes;
00563     unsigned char *p = NULL;
00564     res = i2d_PUBKEY((EVP_PKEY *)i_pubkey, NULL);
00565     if (res < 0)
00566         return(-1);
00567     bytes = res;
00568     res = ccn_charbuf_append_tt(c, bytes, CCN_BLOB);
00569     if (res < 0)
00570         return(-1);
00571     p = ccn_charbuf_reserve(c, bytes);
00572     if (p == NULL)
00573         return(-1);
00574     res = i2d_PUBKEY((EVP_PKEY *)i_pubkey, &p);
00575     if (res != (int)bytes)
00576         return(-1);
00577     c->length += bytes;
00578     return(bytes);
00579 }
00580 
00581 /* PRNG */
00582 
00583 /**
00584  * Generate pseudo-random bytes.
00585  *
00586  * @param buf is the destination buffer
00587  * @param size is in bytes
00588  */
00589 void
00590 ccn_random_bytes(unsigned char *buf, size_t size)
00591 {
00592     int num = size;
00593     
00594     if (num < 0 || num != size)
00595         abort();
00596     RAND_bytes(buf, num);
00597 }
00598 
00599 /**
00600  * Feed some entropy to the random number generator.
00601  * 
00602  * @param buf is the source buffer
00603  * @param size is in bytes
00604  * @param bits_of_entropy is an estimate; use 0 to make me guess
00605  */
00606 void
00607 ccn_add_entropy(const void *buf, size_t size, int bits_of_entropy)
00608 {
00609     int num = size;
00610     
00611     if (num < 0 || num != size)
00612         abort();
00613     /* Supply a hopefully conservative estimate of entropy. */
00614     if (bits_of_entropy <= 0)
00615         bits_of_entropy = (num < 32) ? 1 : num / 32;
00616     RAND_add((unsigned char *)buf, num, bits_of_entropy * 0.125);
00617 }
